metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9229 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Oniguruma 6.2.0, as used in Oniguruma-mod in Ruby through 2.4.1 and mbstring in PHP through 7.1.5. A SIGSEGV occurs in left_adjust_char_head() during regular expression compilation. Invalid handling of reg->dmax in forward_search_range() could result in an invalid pointer dereference, normally as an immediate denial-of-service condition. It was discovered that Oniguruma incorrectly handled certain regular expressions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information, cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libonig4 - 6.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libonig package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-1').
